attributes.action: All illegal immigrants to be deported within 48 hours & a 10yr ban from a visa!
attributes.background: All illegal immigrants to be deported within 48 hours & a 10yr ban from a visa!
attributes.additional_details:
Illegal immigrants use £3.7billion worth of taxpayer-funded health and education services every year, 
Each one of them is taking advantage of Britain’s free NHS and schools and is costing the Treasury £4,250 per year on average.
This puts a huge strain on the NHS, Housing and Schools throughout the UK.
Make the only immigration legal to the uk to be pre-approved.
And any illegal immigrant to be deported within 48 hours.
With no new visa applications to be made inside the uk.
 without all the Red tape, we can instantly get rid of the people who should not be here! and also discourage all illegal immigration.
anyone one wishing to come to the uk should apply and be pre-approved for a visa or political asylum before they come.

attributes.action: Allow news agencies unrestricted filming in the central lobby of Parliament
attributes.background:
Under present rules, only authorised photography is allowed. 

The UK is fortunate to have one of the world’s great public service broadcasters, not a state broadcaster. As such it is the role of government to allow public scrutiny of interactions and protests, even those critical of the state.
attributes.additional_details:
At lunchtime on 23rd March 2016, during Prime Ministers Questions, Black Rod, the official with responsibility for the parliamentary estates and security, ordered reporters not to take or tweet photos of a protest in the Central Lobby of the Palace of Westminster. 

The BBC’s Norman Smith, who has permission to broadcast from the central lobby, was ordered by the authorities to stop filming mid-broadcast.

http://tinyurl.com/BlackRodVideo

The democratic process must not be subject to censorship

attributes.action: The UK Government to stop wild animal fur imports and skins into the UK.
attributes.background: Wild animals (such as leopards, tiger, crocodiles, turtles, bears and giant otters) are killed for their skin and fur to make profit.  Their skins are used for unnecessary items such as clothing, shoes, handbags and accessories. We want this to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details: We are a group of young people who are passionate about wild animals and want to stop poachers.  We had a visit recently from the Schools' Education Officer from the UK Parlimentary Office.  Previously, we have organised animal rescue club and raised money for the WWF.

attributes.action: Increase the number of physiotherapists in the NHS.
attributes.background:
Waiting times from a GP referral vary from 2 weeks to 3 months or more.
Prompter physiotherapy would:
1. Increase patient mobility, strength, coordination, confidence and well-being.
2. Prevent deterioration or accidents, thereby reducing treatment costs.
3. Reduce pressure on GPs and hospitals.

attributes.action: Save Violet Melchett Health Centre in Chelsea from Closure
attributes.background: Not only is it for family planning, the fantastic team also specialises in women's health and have helped me personally on numerous occasions with same day appointments, when I wasn't able to get an appointment with my GP. It would be a great loss to the Chelsea community if this centre closes.
attributes.additional_details:
https://community.avaaz.org/petitions/save-the-violet-melchett-health-centre-in-chelsea-1 

Chelsea may soon be losing its last remaining family planning clinic in plans being drawn up by the Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea (RBKC) and the NHS, residents and staff have reported. This is despite sexual health diagnoses running at a three year high.

If plans to relocate the Violet Melchett family planning clinic are executed, Chelsea will be left without a dedicated primary family planning clinic.

attributes.action:
Pay carers fair rate
Currently get £73.10wk for35 hrs of care
That's £2.08ph
attributes.background:
Adult carer's currently get £2.08 per hour for providing up to 35 hours of care a week,
The minimum wage is currently £6.70 for over 21.
Let's improve the quality of life for BOTH cared for and carer's PLEASE.
I hear if you are a member of house of Lords you get £350.00 a day for just turning up.
attributes.additional_details:
I am an Independent disabled man.
I was damaged by accidents during surgery.
I need a fair amount of care at times.

attributes.action: Bring Back national service in the UK with forced  conscription
attributes.background: men and women in the uk are fat and lazy and they need to get tough  so the army,royal navy,raf are the way to go.
attributes.additional_details: my late step granddad did national service it made him in to a better man he learnt life skills and went around the world and loved it.

attributes.action: Oppose plans  for responsibility all asylum claims being shifted to the EASO
attributes.background: The FT has brought to our attention plans to make the an EU agency (European Asylum Support Office) responsible for all asylum claims within the EU including the UK, this will mean the UK government will lose control over immigration policy for people arriving from OUTSIDE the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
The story was broken by the Financial times on the 7th March and was also featured on Yahoo news:

http://news.yahoo.com/brussels-propose-overhaul-eu-asylum-system-report-001724988.html

Whether you think we should take more or less non EU migrants surely the member states and not the EU should decide it's migration policy not the EU.

I think we should have assurances of the government position on this issue and whether the Prime Minister and leader of the opposition will oppose these changes.

attributes.action: Make it law that employees are given a day off in lieu for 29 February.
attributes.background: Regardless of what day of the week 29 February falls on, ultimately every 4 years employees are expected to work an extra day, without additional pay. Employers should give employees an extra day off work in lieu every 4 years.

attributes.action: Government to stop giving immigrants and refugees free ESOL and education.
attributes.background: Colleges and educational facilities to stop giving free education to refugees and immigrants funded by the government the educational funds should be given to uk citizens and non citizens should have to pay for their education. bursaries and grants and free courses only available to uk citizens
attributes.additional_details: The amount of money our government spends on education on immigrants and refugees is more then what is allocated to uk citizens. Refugees and immigrants if they can't speak English should pay fees for this education not taking tax payers money to fund this colleges and educational facilities are now over run with ESOL classes ran for free but this money should be allocated to help uk citizens only

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for anyone who harms a disabled child to go to jail
attributes.background: My son who has autism was assaulted by a member of staff at his care home, she was charged with child cruelty, but because she became pregnant she avoided jail. i think anyone who hurts a disabled child should be sent to jail. if you agree please sign

attributes.action: make it compulsory for all pet sitters to be licenced for all pet related work
attributes.background: Kennels, Pet stores and Home boarders are required to be licenced by the local council but pet sitters and dog walkers are able to trade without any training, experience or governing body allowing anybody to care for peoples pets. This is not only bad for animal welfare but also bad for the industry

attributes.action: Prevent Highways agency from removing centre white lines from UK roads
attributes.background: The Highways Agency argue that removing the centre white line creates driver uncertainty and a resultant reduction in speed which will reduce Road Traffic Collisions. There is a groundswell of opinion that a lot of drivers use the white line as a measure of safe road positioning.
attributes.additional_details:
Speaking to The Times, AA’s head of road policy, Paul Watters, said: ‘Without exaggeration it is true to say that a simple pot of paint can save lives.
‘In particular, highly visible markings at the edge and centre of the road that can be seen on a wet night are enormously cost-effective in saving lives.’

attributes.action: Re-open the Railway line from Butterley
attributes.background:
I would like the UK Government to consider reopening the former Midland Railway line that ran from Butterley to Derby which also linked up with the Ambergate to Pye Bridge railway line

I believe reopening the section of the line between Butterley and Pye Bridge has huge benefits.
attributes.additional_details:
I think the top authority for the county of Derbyshire, which is Derbyshire County Council should back this petition, because something needs to be done in order to reopen this railway line, and bring back trains to the area!

Trains are needed in this area, in order to reconnect this part of the county that hasn't had a train pass through it in over fifty years!

attributes.action: Make childcare funding available quickly and pay directly to childcare providers
attributes.background: The HMRC can take up to 12 weeks and often longer before they approve funding and pay out to the parents If the HMRC could change their regulations and give child minders guarantee than parents could go back to employment easier and childcare providers would be assured of payment for their services.
attributes.additional_details: As child minders we find ourselves often in the situation where parents build up a back log of fees outstanding because the HMRC haven't approved their funding or stopped it. What do you do in such a situation? We have built up relationships with the child and its parent(s) and its not in the best interest of the child to terminate it. We want the HMRC to speed up the process and pay the child care provider directly to give us security for the hard work we do.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to move the Houses of Parliament out of London permanently.
attributes.background: The Houses of Parliament require refurbishment.  There appears to have been no REAL consideration of why it needs to remain in central London.  Cost savings and befits of decentralisation from London centric economy would all be achieved by moving it elsewhere in the UK

attributes.action: Make finding cures for our cancers the number one scientific priority.
attributes.background: In the UK, one out of every three people will develope cancer, that's a third of the goverment's voters! One in eight females will develope breast cancer- that's one in every fourth house! Both my wife and daughter have been diagnosed, so I'm motivated to get this goverment's priorities changed!
attributes.additional_details: We need to march in the streets banging big drums until things change! Humankind has an inherent selfish streak; we would rather entertain ourselves by spending billions of Euros, sending a spaceprobe to Mars in the hope of getting a clue, as to whether sola winds, could have been the cause of Mars losing its atmospere millions of years ago. Knowledge we can survive without. We don't need the serendipitous crumbs that may fall off the table of space exploration, but specifically targeted funds!

attributes.action: Make Car Insurance Company pay back 20% of Annual premium if no claims were made
attributes.background: Motorist in the UK pay an unjustified amount of annual premium on their car insurance. This however doesn't necessarily reduce with every year that passes by. The insane cost of car insurance ranges from £300-£3000/year in most cases. I believe careful drivers should be rewarded with a 20%cash back.

attributes.action: Reinvest the Google tax bill settlement in the NHS.
attributes.background: The recent tax bill settlement by Google of c£130m should be reinvested straight into the NHS.  This act will alleviate some of the immediate problems within the NHS and, in the long run, allow some recovery of this vital national service.

attributes.action: FREE NHS Prescription,  Dentist and Optician for  ALL Taxpayers and Contributors
attributes.background: We are living in an unfair society, those are making contribution and paying tax by working very hard to fund the FREE NHS Prescription, NHS Dental Treatment and NHS Eyecare Services but we are not getting anything back from our contribution.
attributes.additional_details:
Those who have decided to stay on benefit and are not making any contribution and paying any tax to fund the FREE NHS Prescription, NHS Dental Treatment and NHS Eyecare Services are getting everything for FREE.
We need the State to give are back or giving us the option to opt out as my statement of National Insurance account shows that I am contributing for the NHS.

attributes.action: Longer/ harsher sentences for pedophiles
attributes.background: The sentences that pedophiles and child abusers  get given is a joke. They ruin peoples life's . The child and the family of the children get given a life sentence. Its a joke to think that someone can violate a child in the worse way possible and get just a slap on the wrist and think nothing of it
attributes.additional_details: These sick people just carry on with their lives while the people that are abused never get over it no matter how hard they try. To think some people get a 10 to 12 month sentence for this crime. They need a minimum of 10 years make it a real punishment for a real crime.

attributes.action: Ban UKPC from being able to recieve driver information from the DVLA.
attributes.background: On Mon 11/1/16 the BBC will air a broadcast about UKPC within their Inside Out West Midlands at 19:30 GMT. This will be avaliable on the BBC iPlayer afterwards also. UKPC have been found on the 9/15 to be in vialation and given sanction points. Now they have been found out again. Action is needed.
attributes.additional_details:
BBC Inside Out West Midlands is on Monday 11 January on BBC One at 19:30 GMT and available afterwards on iPlayer.

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-35253759

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-lincolnshire-34402322

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3229165/Is-PROOF-private-parking-firms-scamming-motorists-Drivers-say-timings-photos-doctored-legally-parked-cars-issued-fines.html

http://forums.moneysavingexpert.com/showthread.php?t=4766249

attributes.action: Make its so cars don't have to have their number plates on the front.
attributes.background: I don't see it fair that motorbikes are aloud to ride around the uk streets with just a back number plate and no front one, so I think that cars should only have to have a back number plate aswell.

attributes.action: The UK should join EFTA and should stay out of the EEA and Schengen.
attributes.background: So we can maintain free trade with European countries whilst maintaining our borders outside of the EU

attributes.action: Call a legally binding Euro referendum, 16+ voting age, 2-week campaign.
attributes.background: The non-binding referendum on UK membership of the EU resulted in a majority for 'Leave'. The consequences are becoming apparent. Since the UK has not yet triggered Clause 50, we should re-run the referendum with slightly changed rules, so that voters can decide based on the evidence at hand.
attributes.additional_details: Both sides' campaigns were unsatisfactory in providing objective information about the consequences of deciding to stay or leave. While voters accept exaggeration and distortion of facts during election campaigns, the consequences are generally short-term and reversible due to the 5-year terms of governments. For the EU referendum, however, the consequences are permanent and irreversible. A number of key 'pledges' have already been disowned by Leave campaigners, and some real-life consequences of Brexit have already become apparent. UK voters should take this information into account, and decide what they want.

attributes.action: Call a referendum on the UK joining the European Free Trade Association (EFTA)
attributes.background: EFTA is a free trade area and currently includes Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, and Switzerland. It operates in parallel with the EU, and all its member states participate in the EU's single market. Norway rejected membership of the EU in national referendums in 1973 and 1995, but stayed in EFTA.

attributes.action: Lower the Voting Age to 15 so 15-17 year olds can vote.
attributes.background: I think that people aged 15 and above should have the right to vote in future Referendums and Prime Minister Elections. Young adults are taught in Schools about Politics and the Government so they will have a clear understanding of why and what they are voting for.

attributes.action: Hold an EU referendum where it is illegal  to knowingly misrepresent the facts
attributes.background: Many people voted in The EU referendum based on statements which campaign Leaders have admitted were mistakes.  We believe there would have been a different outcome if it was illegal to make false representations to the public and call on the outcome to be set aside and a new referendum to be held

attributes.action: Petition for London and the South East to breakaway from the UK
attributes.background: After the Brexit vote, London clearly has a different stance on the future to the rest of the country. London also has a vastly different economy to the rest of the country so breaking away makes sesne
attributes.additional_details:
Regional Brexit vote split

http://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/2016-brexit-referendum/

attributes.action: Government fund Boot Camps for teenagers instead of children's homes and units
attributes.background: More and more children and teenagers become worse off after being referred to care homes and units. The reason being is that they end up establishing new relationships with others who have considerably worse issues. The result of this can have a severe negative impact rather than help the situation.
attributes.additional_details: We want to prevent children and teenagers from enduring this type of situation. They also regularly go missing from homes resulting in more police resources. Police have confirmed that missing children is a regularity which is often a waste of police time. If we were to introduce teenage bootcamps it would prevent a lot of future crime and saving expenses on services such as police, social work, alcohol addiction, drug rehabilitation, psychologists, prison sentences, teenage pregnancies and more

attributes.action: Call for a vote of no confidence in PM Cameron post EU referendum.
attributes.background: In the event of a leave majority in the forth coming EU referendum we the people request that all Members of Parliament be made directly aware by the House of Commons Speaker to the announcement of our desire for a vote of no confidence in Prime Minister David Cameron.

attributes.action: Don't scrap A level/GCSE Electronics/Systems and control. Help future engineers.
attributes.background: Scrapping these subjects will cause a fall in the amount of students leaving school with any design or electronics experience or knowledge. We should be encouraging students to become enginneers to continue advancements in technology for the future, instead this opportunity is being taken from them.
attributes.additional_details: Gonernment changes to A levels and GCSEs are moving more towards pure academia and although physics and maths are critical in technology and electronics, to be successful in the industry you must still know how to design, how a circuit works, about microchips etc. The things you are not taught in physics. Without these subjects, less people will be inspired to make their own projects and those who are inspired will be ill equipped to do so and will struggle at degree level with no experience.

attributes.action: Boycott the 2018 World Cup in Russia
attributes.background:
After the violence and racism by Russian supporters in the Euro 2016 football tournament in France. 
I would like the Government Ministers to boycott anything to do with the 2018 World Cup in Russia.
attributes.additional_details: If our government can do this. It will show they are looking out for the safety of the British Citizens which would be at risk if they were to fly out there. And with Government support, the British people, FA, World Cup sponsors and other qualifying countries may consider boycotting the tournament as well. Our Gouvernment needs to show it will not support at tournament that was won on bribes and cannot promise the safety of the British public.

attributes.action: Make vaccine inserts mandatory to receive before being given any vaccination.
attributes.background: This isn't about being pro or anti vaccinations. This is about knowledge and being able to make an informed choice in whichever choice you choose.
attributes.additional_details: By reading the vaccine insert it will help educate the person on the possible adverse reactions, it will help parents notice vaccine damage a lot earlier if it arises, you will be able to read the study details and see all ingredients in the vaccination before deciding to go ahead with them.

attributes.action: Stop testing children in Year 1 on 'alien' words (words that have been made up)!
attributes.background: In Year 1 children take a phonics check.  It is a test made up of real and 'made up' words.  The child is tested to make sure their phonics knowledge is at the expected level.  They should only be tested on real words that are in the dictionary.
attributes.additional_details: It seems so silly to test children who can read fluently on words they will never come across again as they are no where to be found within the English dictionary.  Words such as 'quather' or 'jove'.  The English language is not a phonetically correct language.  We have 26 letters and 44 sounds (43 in some areas because of dialect differences).  Rules for some words are not the same for other words for example, come and home.  The 'o' sound in both words are very different.

attributes.action: Ban letting agents from charging letting fees to renters.
attributes.background: Renters are hit with high costs every time they move. It is time to bring an end to expensive letting fees which are already banned in Scotland and which allow letting agents to unfairly 'double charge' both the landlord and the tenant.

attributes.action: Close all remaining 'City' zoo's.
attributes.background: After the events this bank holiday weekend, we feel enough is enough. No longer shall we pay to see animals held in closed captivity. City zoo's across the country should be closed. With such great places as West Midlands safari etc there is no need for city zoo's, anymore.

attributes.action: Make London the test city for medical/recreational marijuana
attributes.background:
Create a legal market for marijuana in the UK. With the goal of taking money out of crinmals hands, collecting tax to be used in the health and education sector and to get access to an organic substance that is safer than alcohol.
Age Limit - 20+
Possession for personal consumption - 2 Ounces

attributes.action: Referendum to change Britain into a secular republic with an elected  president.
attributes.background: We must give the British people a voice over the one that has stolen our voice.
attributes.additional_details: It's an embarrassment to democracy for us to have an unelected head of state. The Monarchy system is old fashioned and out-dated. Not only is it undemocratic but the British taxpayer spends billions of pounds to an the British monarchy when it could be used to save the NHS and solve the housing crisis in Britain. British society is based on meritocracy and how can Britain claim this with a rich blood-line monarchy which is based on birth.

attributes.action: Mandatory air rifle registration with a 2 year period to register.
attributes.background:
Make mandatory registration of air rifles.
Currently in the UK anyone can own an air rifle & use these to illegally shoot on lands without permission committing the acts of armed trespass and poaching.
Some shoot pets escape prosecution and costs owners thousands of pounds!
www.ukgunbook.com
attributes.additional_details:
By making registration mandatory ( 2 year period to register ) it will help solve crimes of pets that have been shot and / or killed.
It will also make sure that owners are punished for offences committed with their weapons.
We dont want to stop people shooting, we just want to ensure those that own weapons are using them sensibly, on lands with permission.
Similar to the UK Gunlaws on ShotGun ownership.
£15 per weapon registration and £10 per year renewal fees for up to 10 serialised weapons.

attributes.action: Debate the EU's Five Presidents’ Report & its likely impact on the UK.
attributes.background:
The report proposes the completion of Europe’s Economic, Monetary & Political Union.  It uses the terms 'euro area' and 'EU' in relation to its propositions; thus a likely impact on non-euro sovereign states such as the UK.
My concern is that our MPs are not fully aware of its content or impact.
attributes.additional_details:
The report can be accessed at: https://ec.europa.eu/priorities/publications/five-presidents-report-completing-europes-economic-and-monetary-union_en.
It states, 'And finally, towards a Political Union that provides the foundation - - - '. 
It uses doublespeak such as, 'The euro is a successful and stable currency', not withstanding the intractable problems a common currency has given countries such as Greece.

attributes.action: Strip police officers who have falsified statements, of their Police Pension.
attributes.background: We petition the Government to strip police officers found to have falsified statements following and relating to the Hillsborough Disaster of 15 April 1989 of their Police Pension. It is disgraceful that in the years since lies have been perpetuated. Change the law, enabling stripping of pensions.

attributes.action: Government must provide Framework Documents on governance after EU Referendum
attributes.background: The Government provided the People of the UK with a referendum on whether they wish to stay in or leave the EU. The Government must therefore provide two framework documents that give clear guidance on how the UK would be governed under each option so that the People can reach a considered decision
attributes.additional_details:
Background information on why the Government should provide these two framework documents and the consequences if they do not, can be reviewed by the following link

https://www.dropbox.com/s/6nprf1f6wrth3bx/The%20forthcoming%20EU%20Referendum_Revision%201_Final%20Draft.pdf?dl=0

attributes.action: It's time to make the UK Lottery have minimum pay-outs
attributes.background: There should be minimum pay-outs for 4, 5, and 5 plus the bonus ball. It should come out of their exorbitant profits, they have already moved the goalposts by increasing the price and numbers on the draw , time to be fairer, or time for a total boycott

attributes.action: Stop the closure of malling health at telford town centre
attributes.background: It was announced today that the walk in centre and gp practise is being closed down leaving over 3000 patients without a gp please help stop this up coming closure it took me a long time to find a decent gp and have been at this gp practise myself for 6 years

attributes.action: Make childcare costs exempt from Income tax
attributes.background:
We request the Government to make the child care costs exempt from income tax. This will help in two ways
1. Help provide relief to families 
2. Help bring more people especially women into the workforce.
attributes.additional_details:
1. According to an OECD report - The UK has the highest costs of childcare for any country apart from Switzerland - 26.6% of average family incomes, compared to an OECD average of 11.8%.  
2.  While the long term solution would be to bring the childcare costs down, making them tax exempt would atleast provide some relief in the interim.
3. Families are bringing up the future generation, who will work, contribute to pensions, support the elderly and society.

attributes.action: Allow 16 year olds to ride 125cc motorbikes
attributes.background: Restricting a 16 year old to a 50cc, which by law can only go 30mph is dangerous, when you think that most roads they ride on are faster than 30mph. An example of this issue is a country road, where the speed limit is 60mph, so that's a 30mph difference.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to use power tools past 20:00 hours in home D.I.Y
attributes.background: We all suffer nuisance neighbours from time to time.  If there is a law then it makes life easier to destinguish right and wrongs.  If there is a 20:00hrs stoppage to mechanical D.I.Y it makes people consider others and what they are putting them through.
attributes.additional_details: The reason I am bringing this to the for is because I have had a neighbour starting work at 15:00 approx and continuing until 22:00plus for over two months.  I have a son studying for his GCSE exams and we all work and just want to relax.  The other side have young children.  I have asked them to stop earlier and it has fallen on deaf ears with complete denial.  I feel this is a reasonable request that will make life more harmonial whilst still allowing what needs to be done, the time to do it.

attributes.action: Free fruit should be given to children in schools! To promote healthilyLifestyle
attributes.background: Free fruit should be given out to children in schools to help promote healthier lifestyle to combate vast illness.Like obesity,dieabetes and other chronic illness.This would help take some pressure off the NHS ,improve people general health and well-being and mental health!
attributes.additional_details:
(NCMP) 2014/15, show that 19.1% of children in Year 6 (aged 10-11) were obese and a further 14.2% were overweight. Of children in Reception (aged 4-5), 9.1% were obese and another 12.8% were overweight. This means a third of 10-11 year olds and over a fifth of 4-5 year olds were overweight or obese. 

Estimated of (those costs arising from the impact of obesity on the wider economy such as loss of productivity) over the same time period ranged between £2.6 billion [1] and £15.8 billion.[2]

attributes.action: Demand a public inquiry into how EU medical expenses have been going unclaimed.
attributes.background: New figures show the NHS is paying out millions more for EU healthcare than it is claiming back from EU countries.Described as a "scandalous failure",it has emerged that the UK pays more than £670m to EU countries for Brits' healthcare abroad, while claiming back less than £50m from the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
MP John Mann, who obtained the figures in a parliamentary question, told Sky News that "logically the UK should be receiving more than it pays out".

He estimates "the real cost is a billion pounds a year". 

Mr Mann told Sky News: "Other countries are recharging and we are not.

"The figures are astonishing - we are paying them 70 times more than they are paying us.
